results.title: Helping hand
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Heart of the matter”.
Explains how current EEC policy of dumping surpluss food on Third World Countries simply encourages governments to do nothing about their own problems and that cash aid is preferable as it can be used to directly improve the infrastructure. Also the logistics involved in the distribution of EEC surplus in Ethiopia.

results.title: Helpful Henry
results.brief_description: City boy spends summer on a farm and seems to think they should change their way of living. He has his own ideas about how things work, but eventually finds he is wrong and needs to learn from others.

results.title: Helpers: personalising the instruction of reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Louise Henry, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.) and Veriation Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the use of supportive personnel in individualising instruction and meeting the needs of students. Illustrates the process used to prepare teachers to work with volunteers, and the professional relationship which exists between the principal, teachers and volunteers.

results.title: Helpem Mifala: aid for Solomon Islands
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Don Murray and Australian Agency for International Development
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s aid scheme to the Solomon Islands which became independent in 1978. As well as financial aid, technical and medical advisors are assisting the Islands in their development. Photographer - Dean Semler; editor - Sue Horsley; sound - Bob Hayes.

results.title: Help yourself to better health
results.creator_credit: Jamil Simon and Jamil Simon Productions
results.brief_description: This film illustrates how good nutrition is possible with limited budgets, varying food habits, and different cooking facilities. A trip through a supermarket with an older person demonstrates how older people can shop wisely and nutritionally.

results.title: Help yourself - self employment (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Self-employed people describe their work and explain why they are self employed. Their occupations vary from handyman, stallholders, to a proprietor of a chain of jeans stores. All of these businesses started with relatively small amounts of capital. The video also outlines essential steps to be taken by people considering self-employment and lists contacts who can give useful advice.

results.title: Help wanted: secretary
results.brief_description: A good secretary requires a state of mind that goes beyond the basic secretarial skills. Three situations in which bad secretarial practices are demonstrated are seen and are followed by a short restatement of the desired qualities of a good secretary.

results.title: Help me find myself
results.brief_description: Gerard Kennedy explains cerebral palsy, of which spasticity is one form. The film shows children and adults utilising their abilities to lead as normal a life as possible.

results.title: Help me die
results.creator_credit: Brenda Buratti, Lori Hope and KGW-TV Portland
results.brief_description: This program explores the controversial issue of euthanasia and probes the ethical issues involved when terminally ill loved ones ask a physician or family member for assistance in ending their life. It profiles individuals who want to end their pain through suicide, as well as others who seek pain relief through medication - or through programs which will allow them to die with dignity. This documentary invites us all to examine more closely conceptions of personal rights and responsibilities.
